intro: Endiandra spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed endiandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark-brown bark and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers followed by round, fleshy fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
